abstract.text: A model you train to classify motion sensor data.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: An activity classifier is a machine-learning model that your app can use to categorize user
the motion of the user’s device.
You create an activity classifier by gathering a training dataset of a device’s motion sensors, such as the
accelerometer and gyroscope on an Apple Watch. For example, you can create an activity classifier that recognizes a
person waving, shaking hands, or throwing a ball by gathering the motion-sensor data from people performing those
Evaluate your trained activity classifier by calling
with a dataset that’s completely distinct from the training and
validation datasets. Inspect the metrics the method returns and decide whether the activity classifier performs
with enough accuracy. For example, you can assess how often the activity classifier confuses a person waving for
shaking hands, or vice versa. If the classifier makes too many mistakes, you can train another classifier with
different parameters, or with a training dataset that has more or better motion-sensor examples.
When you’re satisfied with an activity classifier, save it as a Core ML model file, and add it to your Xcode
project. Use it to predict the user’s activity based on the motion-sensor data your app captures from the user’s

abstract.text: Create machine learning models for use in your app.
A model you train to classify motion sensor data.
A data source for an activity classifier.
Model training parameters that direct the training process for an
activity classifier model.
A text representation of the activity classifier that’s suitable for output during debugging.
A text representation of the activity classifier.
Generates metrics describing the activity classifier’s performance on
labeled activities in a data source.
Generates metrics describing the activity classifier’s performance on labeled activities in a data table.
The names of the feature columns the activity classifier used during its training session.
Creates an activity classifier from a training session checkpoint.
Creates an activity classifier with a training dataset represented by a data table.
Creates an activity classifier with a training dataset represented by a data source.
The name of the label column the activity classifier used during its training session.
Creates an asynchronous training session for an activity classifier.
Creates an asynchronous training session for an activity classifier.
The underlying Core ML model of the activity classifier stored in memory.
The model configuration parameters the activity classifier used during its training session.
A description of the activity classifier shown in a playground.
Predict activities from new observations.
Predict activities from new observations.
The name of the column that contains the data files the activity classifier used during its training session.
Creates an asynchronous training session for an activity classifier by restoring an existing training session’s
state from its parameters.
Begins or continues an asynchronous activity classifier training session.
Begins an asynchronous activity classifier training session with a
training dataset represented by a data table.
Begins an asynchronous activity classifier training session with a
training dataset represented by a data source.
Measurements of the activity classifier’s performance on the training dataset.
Measurements of the activity classifier’s performance on the validation dataset.
Exports the activity classifier as a Core ML model file.
Exports the activity classifier as a Core ML model file.
Generates metrics by evaluating the sound classifier’s performance on a dataset represented by a data source.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type that supplies a custom description for playground logging.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
